MIT\r\npragma solidity ^0.8.28;\r\n\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/ERC721.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/extensions/ERC721Enumerable.sol\";\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol\";\r\nimport \"../interfaces/IDepositCertificate.sol\";\r\n\r\n/**\r\n * @title DepositCertificate\r\n * @author Saving Banking Team\r\n * @notice ERC721 NFT contract representing deposit certificates for saving plans\r\n * @dev Each deposit is represented by a unique, transferable NFT certificate\r\n * \r\n * Features:\r\n * - Mints NFT when user creates a deposit (tokenId = depositId)\r\n * - Burns NFT when deposit is closed (optional, currently not used)\r\n * - Supports enumeration for listing user's certificates\r\n * - Transferable: allows secondary market for deposit positions\r\n * \r\n * Security:\r\n * - Only MINTER_ROLE (typically SavingBank) can mint/burn certificates\r\n * - DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE can manage roles and set base URI\r\n */\r\ncontract DepositCertificate is ERC721, ERC721Enumerable, AccessControl, IDepositCertificate {\r\n    /// @notice Role identifier for minting and burning certificates\r\n    bytes32 public constant MINTER_ROLE = keccak256(\"MINTER_ROLE\");\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Transfer cooldown period (24 hours) - prevents instant transfer\u2192withdrawal attacks\r\n    uint256 public constant TRANSFER_COOLDOWN = 24 hours;\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Mapping to track which deposit IDs have certificates\r\n    mapping(uint256 => bool) private _depositExists;\r\n    \r\n    /// @dev Mapping to track last transfer timestamp for each token\r\n    mapping(uint256 => uint256) private _lastTransferTime;\r\n    \r\n    /// @dev Base URI for token metadata\r\n    string private _baseTokenURI;\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Initializes the NFT collection with name and symbol\r\n     * @dev Grants DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE and MINTER_ROLE to deployer\r\n     * @param name The name of the NFT collection (e.g., \"SavingBank Deposit Certificate\")\r\n     * @param symbol The symbol of the NFT collection (e.g., \"SBDC\")\r\n     */\r\n    constructor(string memory name, string memory symbol) ERC721(name, symbol) {\r\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender);\r\n        _grantRole(MINTER_ROLE, msg.sender);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Mints a certificate NFT to represent a deposit\r\n     * @dev Only callable by addresses with MINTER_ROLE (typically SavingBank)\r\n     * @param to The address that will own the certificate\r\n     * @param depositId The unique deposit ID (also becomes the tokenId)\r\n     * @return The tokenId of the minted certificate (same as depositId)\r\n     * \r\n     * Requirements:\r\n     * - Certificate for this depositId must not already exist\r\n     * - to must not be zero address\r\n     * \r\n     * Note: The depositId is used as the tokenId for easy mapping\r\n     */\r\n    function mintCertificate(address to, uint256 depositId) external onlyRole(MINTER_ROLE) returns (uint256) {\r\n        require(!_depositExists[depositId], \"Certificate already exists for this deposit\");\r\n        require(to != address(0), \"Cannot mint to zero address\");\r\n        \r\n        _depositExists[depositId] = true;\r\n        _safeMint(to, depositId);\r\n        return depositId; // tokenId is the same as depositId\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Burns a certificate NFT when deposit is closed\r\n     * @dev Only callable by addresses with MINTER_ROLE\r\n     * @param depositId The deposit ID whose certificate will be burned\r\n     * \r\n     * Requirements:\r\n     * - Certificate for this depositId must exist\r\n     * \r\n     * Note: Currently not used in SavingBank (certificates remain after withdrawal)\r\n     */\r\n    function burnCertificate(uint256 depositId) external onlyRole(MINTER_ROLE) {\r\n        require(_depositExists[depositId], \"Certificate does not exist\");\r\n        \r\n        _depositExists[depositId] = false;\r\n        _burn(depositId);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Checks if a certificate exists for a given deposit ID\r\n     * @param depositId The deposit ID to check\r\n     * @return True if certificate exists, false otherwise\r\n     */\r\n    function exists(uint256 depositId) external view returns (bool) {\r\n        return _depositExists[depositId];\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Sets the base URI for token metadata\r\n     * @dev Only callable by DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE\r\n     * @param baseTokenURI The base URI to set (e.g., \"https://api.savingbank.com/certificates/\")\r\n     */\r\n    function setBaseURI(string memory baseTokenURI) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\r\n        _baseTokenURI = baseTokenURI;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Returns the base URI for token metadata\r\n     * @return The configured base URI string\r\n     */\r\n    function _baseURI() internal view override returns (string memory) {\r\n        return _baseTokenURI;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev Override required for ERC721Enumerable compatibility\r\n     * Also tracks transfer timestamps for cooldown mechanism\r\n     */\r\n    function _update(address to, uint256 tokenId, address auth)\r\n        internal\r\n        override(ERC721, ERC721Enumerable)\r\n        returns (address)\r\n    {\r\n        address from = super._update(to, tokenId, auth);\r\n        \r\n        // Track transfer time (skip for mint/burn operations)\r\n        if (from != address(0) && to != address(0)) {\r\n            _lastTransferTime[tokenId] = block.timestamp;\r\n            emit CertificateTransferred(tokenId, from, to, block.timestamp);\r\n        }\r\n        \r\n        return from;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Get the last transfer timestamp for a token\r\n     * @param tokenId The token ID to check\r\n     * @return The timestamp of the last transfer (0 if never transferred)\r\n     */\r\n    function getLastTransferTime(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256) {\r\n        return _lastTransferTime[tokenId];\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Check if a token is in transfer cooldown period\r\n     * @param tokenId The token ID to check\r\n     * @return True if still in cooldown, false if cooldown expired or never transferred\r\n     */\r\n    function isInCooldown(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (bool) {\r\n        uint256 lastTransfer = _lastTransferTime[tokenId];\r\n        if (lastTransfer == 0) return false;\r\n        return block.timestamp < lastTransfer + TRANSFER_COOLDOWN;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Get remaining cooldown time for a token\r\n     * @param tokenId The token ID to check\r\n     * @return Remaining seconds in cooldown (0 if not in cooldown)\r\n     */\r\n    function getRemainingCooldown(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256) {\r\n        uint256 lastTransfer = _lastTransferTime[tokenId];\r\n        if (lastTransfer == 0) return 0;\r\n        uint256 cooldownEnd = lastTransfer + TRANSFER_COOLDOWN;\r\n        if (block.timestamp >= cooldownEnd) return 0;\r\n        return cooldownEnd - block.timestamp;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Emitted when a certificate is transferred between addresses\r\n    event CertificateTransferred(\r\n        uint256 indexed tokenId,\r\n        address indexed from,\r\n        address indexed to,\r\n        uint256 timestamp\r\n    );\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev Override required for ERC721Enumerable compatibility\r\n     */\r\n    function _increaseBalance(address account, uint128 value)\r\n        internal\r\n        override(ERC721, ERC721Enumerable)\r\n    {\r\n        super._increaseBalance(account, value);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @notice Checks if the contract supports a given interface\r\n     * @param interfaceId The interface identifier to check\r\n     * @return True if the interface is supported\r\n     */\r\n    function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId)\r\n        public\r\n        view\r\n        override(ERC721, ERC721Enumerable, AccessControl, IERC165)\r\n        returns (bool)\r\n    {\r\n        return super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\r\n    }\r\n}","keccak256":"0x753c4836557268bf7094898f4f9fc30af747c8b305ad748a0f50aaa6c1c2d1e5","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IDepositCertificate.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\r\npragma solidity ^0.8.28;\r\n\r\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/IERC721.sol\";\r\n\r\ninterface IDepositCertificate is IERC721 {\r\n    function mintCertificate(address to, uint256 depositId) external returns (uint256 tokenId);\r\n    function burnCertificate(uint256 depositId) external;\r\n    function exists(uint256 depositId) external view returns (bool);\r\n    \r\n    /// @notice Transfer cooldown period constant (24 hours)\r\n    function TRANSFER_COOLDOWN() external view returns (uint256);\r\n    \r\n    /// @notice Get the last transfer timestamp for a token\r\n    function getLastTransferTime(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256);\r\n    \r\n    /// @notice Check if a token is in transfer cooldown period\r\n    function isInCooldown(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (bool);\r\n    \r\n    /// @notice Get remaining cooldown time for a token\r\n    function getRemainingCooldown(uint256 tokenId) external view returns (uint256);\r\n}\r\n","keccak256":"0x95da2d4089c275079af543181e38e38b063c3378f1d8f8047ce19f43c20df4f3","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.author: Saving Banking Team
devdoc.details: Each deposit is represented by a unique, transferable NFT certificate  Features: - Mints NFT when user creates a deposit (tokenId = depositId) - Burns NFT when deposit is closed (optional, currently not used) - Supports enumeration for listing user's certificates - Transferable: allows secondary market for deposit positions  Security: - Only MINTER_ROLE (typically SavingBank) can mint/burn certificates - DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE can manage roles and set base URI

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

ERC721IncorrectOwner(address,uint256,add.details: Indicates an error related to the ownership over a particular token. Used in transfers.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InsufficientApproval(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `operator`s approval. Used in transfers.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC721InvalidOperator(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `operator` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidOwner(address).details: Indicates that an address can't be an owner. For example, `address(0)` is a forbidden owner in ERC-20. Used in balance queries.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.

ERC721InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721NonexistentToken(uint256).details: Indicates a `tokenId` whose `owner` is the zero address.

ERC721OutOfBoundsIndex(address,uint256).details: An `owner`'s token query was out of bounds for `index`. NOTE: The owner being `address(0)` indicates a global out of bounds index.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

burnCertificate(uint256).details: Only callable by addresses with MINTER_ROLE

params.depositId: The deposit ID whose certificate will be burned  Requirements: - Certificate for this depositId must exist  Note: Currently not used in SavingBank (certificates remain after withdrawal)

constructor.details: Grants DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE and MINTER_ROLE to deployer

params.name: The name of the NFT collection (e.g., "SavingBank Deposit Certificate")
params.symbol: The symbol of the NFT collection (e.g., "SBDC")

returns._0: True if certificate exists, false otherwise
The timestamp of the last transfer (0 if never transferred)
Remaining seconds in cooldown (0 if not in cooldown)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: True if still in cooldown, false if cooldown expired or never transferred

mintCertificate(address,uint256).details: Only callable by addresses with MINTER_ROLE (typically SavingBank)

params.depositId: The unique deposit ID (also becomes the tokenId)
params.to: The address that will own the certificate

returns._0: The tokenId of the minted certificate (same as depositId)  Requirements: - Certificate for this depositId must not already exist - to must not be zero address  Note: The depositId is used as the tokenId for easy mapping

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

returns._0: True if the interface is supported

_depositExists.details: Mapping to track which deposit IDs have certificates

_lastTransferTime.details: Mapping to track last transfer timestamp for each token

CertificateTransferred(uint256,address,a.notice: Emitted when a certificate is transferred between addresses

getRemainingCooldown(uint256).notice: Get remaining cooldown time for a token

isInCooldown(uint256).notice: Check if a token is in transfer cooldown period

mintCertificate(address,uint256).notice: Mints a certificate NFT to represent a deposit

setBaseURI(string).notice: Sets the base URI for token metadata

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Checks if the contract supports a given interface
